text: The Iowa City Metropolitan Region Area, as defined under the United States Census Bureau, is a metro region in East Central Iowa with two main counties. They're Johnson and Washington counties. The former has Iowa City being the county seat and most people living there. According to reports, as of December 31, 2023, the Metro Area had more than 180,000 people living there. ==Communities== *Places with more than 50,000 inhabitants **Iowa City (Principal city) *Places with 5,000 to 50,000 inhabitants **Coralville **North Liberty, at 20%, fastest growing city in Johnson County (2010-2017) **Washington, Iowa *Places with 1,000 to 5,000 inhabitants **Kalona **Lone Tree **Riverside **Solon **Tiffin **Wellman **West Branch (partial) **University Heights *Places with 500 to 1,000 inhabitants **Ainsworth **Brighton **Hills **Oxford **Shueyville **Swisher *Places with less than 500 inhabitants **Coppock (partial) **Crawfordsville **West Chester ==References== Category:Iowa City, Iowa Category:Metropolitan areas of the United States
title: Iowa City metropolitan area
